FileFormat.FormatDescription: Portable Document Format is a platform-independent format for representing formatted documents, originally developed by Adobe Systems Incorporated. PDF 2.0 is standardised by ISO 32000-2. A PDF file comprises a Header section, a Body section containing the objects which make up the document, a Cross Reference Table, and a Trailer section. PDF files can contain a wide variety of content, including text, images, video and audio.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

InternalSignature.SignatureNote:
PDF 2.0 allows an arbitrary amount of information to appear before the PDF 2.0 data starts. For now we are setting a max offset of 4096 bytes from the BOF before we expect to see the %PDF-2.0 tag as this should encompass most use-cases and also maintain processing efficiency for any identification tools using PRONOM data. If you find this offset is inadequate please contact the PRONOM team. Also seeking EOF sequence %%EOF within final 1024 bytes.
This signature cannot currently identify files that were incrementally saved to PDF 2.0 from a previous PDF version (for example PDF 1.7), and this scenario will currently return an identification for the orignal format. Please contact the PRONOM team if you can assist with developing a signature that can account for such a use-case.
